Develop at least one piece of functionality and Create an increment of potentially releasable software

Selected Answer: CE
Scrum requires the team to create working software in each Sprint. The Sprint Goal is to deliver a Done, usable, and potentially shippable Increment
C, E are correct
Option C and E
Take care of how the question was asked. This is a bit misleading because E basically implements the task described in C.
C and E are the correct answer

questions.question_text: Which two things should the Development Team do during the first Sprint? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Develop at least one piece of functionality.
choices.E: Create an increment of potentially releasable software.
choices.A: Make up a plan for the rest of the project.
choices.B: Analyze, describe, and document the requirements for the subsequent Sprints.
choices.D: Analyze, design, and describe the complete architecture and infrastructure.

questions.question_text: Which approach is best for Scrum Teams in order to produce valuable Increments? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.B: Each Scrum Team is accountable for developing functionality from beginning to end.
choices.A: Each Developer works on the component where they feel that they can contribute.
choices.C: Each Scrum Team works on an independent set of components.
choices.D: Each Scrum Member works only as an independent layer of the system.

discussion.content: I would go for B

Selected Answer: B
The team as a total has all the skills needed
I would go for B.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.cross functional scrum team.

I guess A is the answer

questions.question_text: Developers are self-managing, which of the following do they manage?

discussion.content:

Sprint Lenght is decided by the Scrum Team.

B is correct.

choices.D: When to release, based on its progress.

choices.A: The Scrum process, and how it was used during the Sprint.

questions.question_text: Which topics should be discussed in the Sprint Review?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Review not retrospective

Selected Answer: C
On the Sprint Review the increment should be the main topic. The Scrum Process is the topic for the Sprint Retro.

ChatGPT picks C "C. The product Increment.

The primary focus of the Sprint Review is to discuss and inspect the product Increment that was developed during the sprint."

Selected Answer: C
C is right choice

choices.A: The Developers ensure that the Scrum Team is aware, start the Sprint, and monitor progress.
choices.E: Recruit additional Developers before the work can begin.
choices.C: The Developers work overtime during this Sprint.
choices.D: Remove or change selected Product Backlog items.

questions.question_text:
As the Sprint Planning progresses, the Developers realize that the workload may be greater than their capacity to complete the work. Which two are valid actions?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D are correct.
